revised_title: Investigating the Peculiar Behavior of Glow-Lamps at High Incandescence
tldr: The author investigates the behavior of glow-lamps when raised to high incandescence and discovers a connection between the blue effect and the appearance of a shunt current. The experiments reveal that the resistance of the rarefied space increases as the incandescence level rises, and the blue effect serves as a warning of impending filament disintegration.
